item.text: to address the weaknesses I felt were present in the ideas and practice of [[Liquid Democracy]]

[[Liquid Law]] is a project I started in 2004 as a project that aimed to create a flexible [[Human Centred Programming Language]] that was able to capture the ways in which groups of people are able to make fair and or effective decisions.

The name [[Liquid Law]] stems from the original motivation, which was to address the weaknesses I felt were present in the ideas and practice of [[Liquid Democracy]], which was a project I had been working on for a number of years by then.

The name [[Liquid Law]] stems from the original motivation, which was to address the weaknesses I felt were present in the ideas and practice of [[Liquid Democracy]], which was a project I had been working on for a number of years by then.
